"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a190466368723a590002a0#post_55a190466368723a590002a0

If there's one thing I know about Shin Megami Tensei, it's that the protags get progressively hotter.

!http://img4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20110418014712/megamitensei/images/7/7c/P2I-suouTatsuya2.jpg!

Look at how far we've come from _Innocent Sin_.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a1905163687232cd0006df#post_55a1905163687232cd0006df
[bq="uc9"]So apparently Nasa is looking at transforming the moon. . . It's different from terraforming.  Basically what they want to do is that it's not realistic to terraform the entire moon given our current capabilities, but rather what they are thinking of doing is creating a dome that people live in by using a smaller crater to form half it.

Basically less like scifi and more like:
!http://files.archinect.com/uploads/ai/aiu_chester_zoo_biodome_01x.jpg!

That would actually be a pretty good idea, because you could carry out local long term experiments on how to make the moon habitable as a whole.  If the moon ever does become habitable keep in mind we're not talking breathable atmosphere but rather cities in biodomes.

It could be how we get started on colonizing the solar system, scientific labs on the planets and moons dedicated to long term terraforming rather than getting all the shit there from earth.

If you're having a hard time envisioning what I mean:
!http://www.nss.org/settlement/moon/LunarColonyRawlings650.jpg!


Also apparently carbon emissions from cars will be cut by 90% by 2030 due to driverless cars and hybrid vehicles.[/bq]
So basically what Cowboy Bebop did with Mars
!http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/cowboybebop/images/0/0c/2_Marscity.png/revision/latest?cb=20090805152549!
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a1917063687251860003aa#post_55a1917063687251860003aa
Pretty much; terraforming a entire planet would take at least 500 years conservative estimate wise; transforming sections would be doable in one lifetime.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a18b536368725567001221#post_55a18b536368725567001221
Even with all side games, there sure as hell aren't that many Persona games. Are you confusing it with it's parent series?

Man, I remember when MegaTen was very obscure in the west. It's kinda odd to see it relatively well-known (relatively, because a certain, recently-mentioned subseries ridiculously eclipsed it in popularity). The same with Fire Emblem (although not as odd, as it's a Nintendo series and more "mass-compatible").

So, how does Megaten's series _work?_ Is it just one big umbrella series with a ton of takes on its universe? Do all games take place in the same universe? I've never really got how it all fits together.

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a1951d6368720b330001bf#post_55a1951d6368720b330001bf
Man, I never really registered the Tales games as one of the Big JRPG series. Although that might be because it's much younger than the others, having started late in the 16 Bit era.

I never really registered Megami Tensei as one of the big ones either, but that's because of it's (former) obscurity in the west. The high amount of sub-series and massive amount of games overall make clear how big it really is.
